channel.title: PI webclient Help
channel.description:
I've been trying to make a web client for my server. it's still in beta but some of my friends use macs and can't run batch files.
After coding the webclient in it loads then says Error. it doesn't give me any details on the error. My coding is flawless other than the fact that when i delete my cache in my folder the client begins to redownload it and i get an error during unpacking.
here is what it says in the cmd. [code] cache.zip 62866331 java.io.FileNotFoundException: .\Run Hero's cache\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The system cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileReader.<init>(Unknown Source) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:111) at client.startUp(client.java:9046) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:6072) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open(Native Method) at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at Update.unZipFile(Update.java:53) at Update.<init>(Update.java:29) at client.streamLoaderForName(client.java:4766) at client.startUp(client.java:9056) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:6072) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) [/code]
If anyone can help me with this it would be greatly appreciated and i will offer a staff position on my server.

item.title: PI webclient Help
item.dc:creator: @zo0york zo0york
item.description:
@zo0york wrote:

I’ll try that now and repost in about 3minutes if it was successful or not.
EDIT: it works now just gotta test it on the webclient.

Webclient still will not load.

item.title: PI webclient Help
item.dc:creator: @WowILikeToCode WowILikeToCode
item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:

dont zip the cache folder, open the folder thats your cache is in, select all and add that to archive

Read full topic

item.title: PI webclient Help
item.dc:creator: @zo0york zo0york
item.description:
@zo0york wrote:

dubcache.zip    62866331
java.io.FileNotFoundException: .\dubcache\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The system cannot
find the path specified)
        at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method)
        at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at java.io.FileReader.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at client.setNewMaps(client.java:111)
        at client.startUp(client.java:9046)
        at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33)
        at client.run(client.java:6072)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file
        at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open(Native Method)
        at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at Update.unZipFile(Update.java:53)
        at Update.<init>(Update.java:29)
        at client.streamLoaderForName(client.java:4766)
        at client.startUp(client.java:9056)
        at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33)
        at client.run(client.java:6072)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

change upload link in CacheDownloader and signlink. changed cache name to dubcache.

Read full topic

item.title: PI webclient Help
item.dc:creator: @Nonamee Nonamee
item.description:
@Nonamee wrote:

Yeah, I made that error about a week ago when I got back into RSPS.

Anyway, another error I have ever made is compressing it simply. I found out that archiving it as a zip file works.

Read full topic

item.title: PI webclient Help
item.dc:creator: @BitchPk BitchPk
item.description:
@BitchPk wrote:

[quote=“WowILikeToCode, post:2, topic:428322”]client isn’t finding your cache properly, probably because of this

\Run Hero’s cache
Try replacing it with this
\runherocache[/quote]

What a other problem can be, i had the same is

that u Zip ur cache folder

but u have to zip the stuff thats inside of ur cache folder

Read full topic

item.title: PI webclient Help
item.dc:creator: @WowILikeToCode WowILikeToCode
item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:

client isn’t finding your cache properly, probably because of this

\Run Hero’s cache
Try replacing it with this
\runherocache\

Read full topic

item.title: PI webclient Help
item.dc:creator: @zo0york zo0york
item.description:
@zo0york wrote:

I’ve been trying to make a web client for my server. it’s still in beta but some of my friends use macs and can’t run batch files.

After coding the webclient in it loads then says Error. it doesn’t give me any details on the error.
My coding is flawless other than the fact that when i delete my cache in my folder the client begins to redownload it and i get an error during unpacking.

here is what it says in the cmd.

cache.zip       62866331
java.io.FileNotFoundException: .\Run Hero's cache\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The system
 cannot find the path specified)
        at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method)
        at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at java.io.FileReader.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at client.setNewMaps(client.java:111)
        at client.startUp(client.java:9046)
        at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33)
        at client.run(client.java:6072)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file
        at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open(Native Method)
        at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source)

If anyone can help me with this it would be greatly appreciated and i will offer a staff position on my server.
